content: In Greek mythology, who was the god of wine, known as the liberator due to his power to free one from their normal self through madness, ecstasy or wine?

In Greek mythology, the god of wine, known for his ability to liberate individuals through madness, ecstasy, or wine, is Dionysus. He is often associated with fertility, theater, and ritual madness. Dionysus was one of the most complex and significant gods in the Greek pantheon, and his cult was known for its enthusiastic and sometimes chaotic rites.
